fact_check_explanation_title: Fake KFC deal shared by thousands on Facebook
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post claiming social media users can get a voucher “for nothing” has been shared widely.

fact_check_explanation_title: The lowest paid nurses aren’t getting a 9% pay increase
fact_check_explanation_summary: Oliver Dowden MP said multiple times that the lowest paid nurses were given a 9% increase. A newly qualified nurse in England has seen their pay increase by around 5.5% …

fact_check_explanation_title: Health minister’s claims on nurse pay fact checked
fact_check_explanation_summary: Maria Caulfield MP made a number of claims about how much nurse pay increases would cost during multiple media appearances.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook posts claiming to be searching for birth parents are fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: Full Fact has spotted a number of similar posts using the same black and white image of a child, claiming to be searching for a woman called Cathy M Evans.

fact_check_explanation_title: Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla hasn’t resigned
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims that the Pfizer CEO resigned after admitting mRNA vaccines were not safe are inaccurate.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook promotions offering free Center Parcs holidays for sharing posts are false
fact_check_explanation_summary: The promotions are not linked to Center Parcs.

fact_check_explanation_title: Andrew Bridgen's vaccine debate claims fact checked
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Conservative MP made a number of claims about vaccine safety and effectiveness—we’ve fact checked four of them.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post makes harmful claims about treating scarlet fever without antibiotics
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post claims that symptoms of strep A infections can be treated with homeopathic remedies alone.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post about dog found ‘freezing’ in Falkirk is a hoax
fact_check_explanation_summary: The picture accompanying the post was taken from an article about a dog attack in Northern Ireland.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post claiming lemons treat cancer better than chemotherapy is false
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post that has circulated many times in recent years states that lemons are proven to treat and prevent cancer—but this is not true.

fact_check_explanation_title: Unemployment in the UK is currently low by historic standards
fact_check_explanation_summary: The shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves claimed that Britain has “high unemployment” after 12 years of Conservative government. But by historic standards, the unemployment rate is currently very low.

fact_check_explanation_title: You can still pay for Amazon Prime on a monthly basis
fact_check_explanation_summary: We’ve looked into claims that Amazon is moving Prime members in the UK to annual subscriptions.
